newsitem.title: USA: Cerner says no news as stock climbs again.
newsitem.headline: Cerner says no news as stock climbs again.

text.p: Cerner Corp, with its stock building on last week's gains, said on Monday there were no fresh developments on the acquisition proposals the company disclosed earlier.

"I'm not aware of any movement or activity beyond what was stated in our release last Thursday," said Cerner spokeswoman Wendy Coffey. "People are still reacting to the announcement. There were no analyst changes or ratings changes," she said.
Cerner announced a shareholder rights plan and a stock buyback program last week in response to what it described as unsolicited proposals for an acquisition or merger.
The company, which designs information management systems for the health-care industry, declined to identify the suitors.
"These are people who don't follow the story, who want to get in on takeover speculation," said Chris Paul, an analyst with Volpe Welty & Co, referring to buyers of Cerner's stock on Monday.
"Rumors of a buyout are actually old news. The real news is the stock repurchase program," he added.
Cerner was up 1 to 15 in heavier-than-usual trading of 475,000 shares.
